item.description:
A Japanese Hibachi Heaven

Watch hibachi chefs turn meat, fish and vegetables into small feasts within a few dazzling minutes!

The Noble House sparkles. The shiny steel grilles are embedded in marble, and the seating guarantees a convivial occasion.

In North America, the term "hibachi" is used to refer to a small cooking stove heated by charcoal (actually called shichirin in Japanese), or to an iron hot plate (teppan) used in Teppanyaki restaurants which serve a type of Japanese cuisine that uses an iron griddle to cook food. The word "teppanyaki" is derived from teppan, which means iron plate, and yaki, which means grilled. In North America, it is also known by the name of hibachi.

The entrées include a very good miso soup followed by a large, spicy salad, a complimentary flamed shrimp serving and the main course is followed by rice and a pile of sautéed vegetables

Hibachi Dinner Combinations
The combo prices run from $23.95 to $27.95 and include choices like Shrimp & Chicken, Shrimp & Scallop, Sirloin Steak & Chicken, Sirloin Steak & Shrimp, Sirloin Steak & Scallop, Filet Mignon & Chicken and Filet Mignon & Shrimp.

Check out the website for a complete list of prices.

Each Habachi area has one table that seats 8. I have two reserved!
item.how_to_find_us: Just ask for the "Girl's Just Wanna Have Fun Tables!"

group.name: "Girls Just Wanna Have Fun!" Women Social Meetup Group

item.name: Dinner at Noble House
